attributes.action: abandon and abolish plans for the Government to apply new rates to Vehicle Excise Duty (VED), especially vehicles already on the road.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
At the moment it costs a maximum of £210 to tax a vehicle registered between March 2001 and March 2006. The government will increase the tax to £455 in April 2010 for gas-guzzling cars, the higher the emissions the higher the tax.
The scheme would leave a total of 9.4 million motorists significantly worse off and another 8.4 million no better off, with only 4.1 million benefiting.
Five of the top 30 cars, the UK's most popular cars, will have to pay more.

It would have a huge damaging impact on the second hand car market, including unemployment.

It would increase unlicensed vehicles on the road.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
